intro: Thespesia populneoides, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, particularly Hawaii. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink or red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in dry, sunny environments. Thespesia populneoides plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
